alert.note: Alert for Wyoming (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 6:19PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Wyoming County through 645 PM EDT... At 619 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Forkston, or 9 miles southeast of Wyalusing, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Vernon, Tunkhannock, Mehoopany, Meshoppen, Forkston, Osterhout, Evans Falls, Beaumont, Lovelton and Eatonville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
